definition: to get familiar with
confused/dirty/to mix/muddy/variant of 渾|浑[hun2]
to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless
cooked (of food)/ripe (of fruit)/mature (of seeds)/familiar/skilled/done/also pr. [shou2]

sentences.english: Gradually, Lin Ying infant and Mrs Wang mix.
sentences.chinese: 漸漸地，林嬰嬰和汪夫人混熟了。

sentences.english: become familiar with the people and you just make small conversation.
sentences.chinese: 和那裏的人混熟，然後聊聊天兒。

sentences.english: I gradually got acquainted with my new friend.
sentences.chinese: 我漸漸和新朋友混熟了。

sentences.english: "White Tiger" and I got to know each, they will become inseparable friends.
sentences.chinese: “白虎”和我混熟之後，便成了形影不離的好朋友。

definition: familiar/close
to merge/to integrate/to become as one/to unify together
to worm one's way into being friends with sb (usually derogatory)
gradually/little by little/in the course of time
to be able to talk to/to get along with/to be congenial
intimate/friendly/warm/active/lively (interaction, participation etc)
unfamiliar at first, but well accustomed soon enough (idiom)
pinyin: yi1 hui2 sheng1 er4 hui2 shu2

definition: to talk/to get into conversation with/to send word
to try to gain sb's friendship
nodding acquaintance
entertaining in conversation
not to hold anything back (idiom)/(of close friends etc) to tell each other everything
to make friends/(dialect) to start an affair with sb
to be kindred spirits/to hit it off
to share vile habits/partners in notoriety/birds of a feather
see 一回生二回熟[yi1 hui2 sheng1 er4 hui2 shu2]
pinyin: yi1 hui2 sheng1 liang3 hui2 shu2
